intro: Gomphia miersii, commonly known as the Miers' gomphia, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Xanthorrhoeaceae, which includes plants commonly referred to as the yellow rocket family. The plant is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. It is often found in rocky or sandy soils in arid environments. Gomphia miersii is adapted to survive in dry conditions, with a deep root system that helps it access water from deeper underground.
